content: The limit is reached for the number of rooms: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating when the room quota limit has been reached, showing the current value and maximum allowed value. It appears in a quotas bar component, specifically on the Rooms Tariff Limit section.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure 'تم الوصول إلى الحد الأقصى لعدد الغرف' is grammatically correct and flows naturally in Arabic.

While grammatically correct, the translation is somewhat literal. A more natural phrasing in Saudi Arabic might be 'تم استنفاد الحد الأقصى لعدد الغرف' (The maximum number of rooms has been exhausted). However, the current translation isn't technically wrong.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: تم استنفاد الحد الأقصى لعدد الغرف

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variables {{currentValue}} and {{maxValue}} are correctly positioned within the Arabic sentence.

The translation 'ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງເຕັມແລ້ວ' directly translates to 'Number of rooms is full'. While conveying the general meaning, it lacks the nuance of 'The limit is reached for the number of rooms'. A more accurate translation would reflect the 'limit' aspect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງບັນລຸຂີດສຸດທີ່ຮຽກຮ້ອງໄດ້: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Limita maximă permisă de săli a fost atinsă" is a bit verbose and not the most natural way to say it in Romanian. A more direct and common translation would be "S-a atins limita maximă de săli" or "S-a ajuns la limita maximă de săli".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: S-a atins limita maximă de săli

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'කෙටිහන් ගණන සඳහා සීමාව ඉක්මවා ඇත' is not the most natural or accurate rendering of 'The limit is reached for the number of rooms'.  'කෙටිහන්' primarily means 'shorts' or 'briefs'. While 'rooms' could be loosely interpreted, it's misleading. A more accurate translation would convey the idea of reaching a quota or maximum.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation might be something like: 'මාර්ග ඉඩ ප්‍රමාණය සඳහා සීමාව ඉක්මවා ඇත: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}' (Maarga ida pramaṇaya sæpara sæmava ikmava ætha: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}})

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The double curly braces {{ }} used for variables in the English content should ideally be replicated in the Sinhala translation to maintain consistency and clarity for developers.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the variables are consistently represented with double curly braces: 'මාර්ග ඉඩ ප්‍රමාණය සඳහා සීමාව ඉක්මවා ඇත: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation 'Limit počtu miestností je dosiahnutý' directly translates to 'The limit of the number of rooms is reached'. It implies that the limit has been met, but the English implies the limit *is* reached, meaning it's the current state.  A more accurate translation would convey this current state.

The word 'Dostignut' (Reached) isn't the most natural or common way to express reaching a limit in this context. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Prekoračen je limit...' (The limit has been exceeded...) or 'Limit je dostignut...' (The limit has been reached...).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Prekoračen je limit za broj prostorija: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}
